title: This is the door number that can knock £22,000 off your house price
text:
Homeowners who live at number 13 are seeing their value of their property hit by more than £22,000, a study has revealed.

Every year around 1.2 million homes are sold across the UK, with the value of houses dropping dramatically because of the so-called unlucky number.

The research comes from analysis of official Land Registry data by property specialists Stone Real Estate and covers property sales in the UK over the past three years.

After analysing sales data over the past three years, the study found that, on average, Brits who sold homes at number 13 lost out on eight per cent of the average house price when selling up.

Analysts found that the average sale price of homes between 2016 to 2019 was £282,815 across the UK. However, those living at number 13 only got, on average, £260,716 when they sold up.

Many developers for new builds have scrapped homes at No.13 from new housing estates, with only a £4,707 difference in price.
description: Homeowners who live at number 13 are seeing their value of their property hit by more than £22,000, a study has revealed.
